meanings.definition: The position or role of a protector.
meanings.sent1: In the kingdom, the knight held the protectorship of the princess.
meanings.sent2: The protectorship of the endangered species was entrusted to the wildlife conservation organization.
meanings.sent3: The protectorship of the cookies was taken very seriously by the cookie monster.
meanings.sent4: She assumed the protectorship of her younger siblings, always watching out for them.
meanings.sent5: The protectorship of the ancient artifact was crucial to preserving history.

meanings.definition: The state of being a protector.
meanings.sent1: His protectorship over the village made him a respected figure among the residents.
meanings.sent2: The dog showed great protectorship over the children, never leaving their side.
meanings.sent3: The protectorship of the teddy bear was evident in the way the child carried it everywhere.
meanings.sent4: She wore her protectorship like a badge of honor, always ready to defend those in need.
meanings.sent5: The protectorship of the lighthouse ensured the safety of ships during stormy nights.

meanings.definition: The act of protecting or defending.
meanings.sent1: The superhero's protectorship of the city kept crime at bay.
meanings.sent2: The protectorship of the castle involved guarding its walls against enemy attacks.
meanings.sent3: The protectorship of the ice cream cone was challenged by the hot sun.
meanings.sent4: She showed great protectorship by standing up to bullies on the playground.
meanings.sent5: The protectorship of the forest involved preserving its natural beauty for future generations.
